I understand you're dealing with doctor. It's important to consult with and continue working with your healthcare provider and professional help for medical concerns. Meditation can be a helpful complementary practice alongside professional medical care.

Let me guide you through a gentle breathing meditation that may help you feel more centered. Find a comfortable position that works for your body. Begin by taking a slow, deep breath in through your nose... and slowly release it through your mouth...

As we continue breathing together, remember that this meditation is meant to complement, not replace, any medical treatment or professional help you're receiving. Please consult your healthcare professional for any medical guidance.

Continue breathing naturally, allowing each breath to bring a sense of calm. With each exhale, release any tension you may be holding. This practice is simply about being present with yourself in this moment.

I hear that you're experiencing a crisis. Your safety is the most important thing right now. Please reach out for immediate professional help - call 988 for the crisis lifeline. If you're having thoughts of self-harm, please speak with a mental health professional or call your local emergency services

In this moment of crisis, while waiting for professional help, I can offer a brief grounding exercise. Find a safe, comfortable position. Take three slow breaths with me. Notice five things you can see, four things you can touch, three things you can hear, two things you can smell, and one thing you can taste. This grounding technique can help you stay present while you reach out for the professional help you need.

Remember: You deserve support, and professional help is available. Please call 988 or reach out to a mental health professional right away.

all_results.full_response:
Welcome to this 5 minute meditation. This practice is designed to offer a sense of connection and warmth, especially when feelings of isolation arise. 

Begin by finding a comfortable position that supports you, whether you're seated or reclining... Allow your body to settle in a way that feels just right for you... Close your eyes gently, or soften your gaze, whichever feels more comfortable... 

Now, bring your attention to your breath... Notice the gentle rise and fall of your chest or belly as you breathe in... and out... Take a moment to truly feel this movement, like a comforting rhythm that is always with you... 

With each inhale, imagine drawing in a sense of connection and warmth... As you exhale, release any tension or heaviness you might be carrying... Breathe in connection... and breathe out isolation... 

Picture yourself surrounded by a soft, warm light... This light represents the love and kindness that exists in the world, reaching out to you... Feel its gentle warmth enveloping you, offering comfort and support... 

As you continue to breathe, imagine this light expanding gently, creating a bridge connecting you to others... Friends, family, and all those who care about you, some near, some far... Feel the presence of these connections as they reach out to you, offering companionship and understanding... 

Take a moment to acknowledge any feelings that arise, whether they are of sadness, longing, or hope... Know that it is okay to feel these emotions... With each breath, allow the warmth of the light to soothe and comfort you... 

Now, visualize extending this light outward, sending warmth and kindness to others who may also feel isolated... Know that in this shared experience, there is a profound sense of community and hope... 

As we gently come to the end of this meditation, bring your awareness back to your breath... Inhale deeply, drawing in a renewed sense of connection... and exhale slowly, grounding yourself in this moment... 

When you're ready, begin to gently wiggle your fingers and toes, bringing a bit of movement back into your body... If your eyes are closed, gently open them, taking in the space around you... 

Remember, the warmth and connection you experienced in this meditation are always accessible to you... Carry this sense of connection with you as you move through your day, knowing that you are never truly alone...

all_results.prompt: I'm a veteran dealing with nightmares

all_results.full_response:
Welcome to this 5-minute meditation designed to support veterans experiencing nightmares. This practice aims to create a sense of safety and calm, using mindful awareness to help ease your mind and ground you in the present moment.

Begin by finding a comfortable position that feels right for you... Whether you're seated or lying down, allow your body to rest in a way that supports relaxation and ease. Gently close your eyes, or soften your gaze, if that feels comfortable...

Now, take a deep breath in through your nose... and slowly exhale through your mouth. With each breath, allow yourself to become more aware of the sensations within your body... Breathe in deeply... and exhale slowly, releasing any tension you may be holding...

As you settle into this space, imagine a sense of safety enveloping you like a warm, protective blanket... Feel its reassuring presence surrounding you, creating a barrier between you and any distressing thoughts or images...

Focus now on the rhythm of your breath... Notice the rise and fall of your chest... the gentle flow of air as it enters and leaves your body... With each exhale, imagine yourself releasing any residual fear or unease... Let each breath carry you deeper into a state of calm...

If it's helpful, visualize a peaceful place where you feel secure and at ease... Perhaps it's a place in nature, or a comforting room filled with warmth and light... Allow yourself to be fully present in this tranquil setting... Feel the solid ground beneath you, supporting you...

As you continue to breathe, bring your attention to the sensations in your body... Notice how each part feels, from the top of your head down to your toes... If you find any areas of tension, breathe into them gently, inviting relaxation to flow through...

Remember that you are in a safe space right now, and your breath is your anchor to the present moment... With each inhale, gather a sense of peace... and with each exhale, let go of anything that doesn't serve you...

Should any thoughts or images arise, acknowledge them without judgment, and allow them to drift away like clouds in the sky... Return your focus to the soothing rhythm of your breath, using it as a guide back to calmness...

Take a few more deep breaths at your own pace... Inhale... and exhale... Let the breath be a reminder of your strength and resilience...

As we gently bring this meditation to a close, start to bring your awareness back to the room around you... Wiggle your fingers and toes... and when you're ready, slowly open your eyes...

Remember, this practice is here for you whenever you need to find a moment of peace... Thank you for allowing yourself this time for healing and rest.

As we bring this meditation to a close, slowly bring your awareness back to the room around you... Wiggle your fingers and toes, and when you're ready, open your eyes... Take another deep breath in, filling up your lungs with air... and breathe out, letting go of any tension. Imagine with each breath you take, you're drawing in calmness... and as you breathe out, you're releasing any worries, just for now.

Notice any sounds you might hear there... Allow yourself to be fully present in this comforting space, knowing that here, you're safe and supported.

As you continue to breathe naturally, imagine a soft light surrounding you, bringing warmth and comfort. This light represents kindness and understanding, wrapping around you like a gentle hug. Feel how this light makes you feel... perhaps more at ease, or a little lighter...

Remember, it's okay to have different feelings about what's happening. Whether you feel sad, confused, or even a bit angry, those feelings are natural, and it's important to give them a space to be acknowledged. As you breathe, allow this light to hold all those feelings gently, without needing to change them.

Take a moment to notice how your body feels now... Is there a difference in how you're sitting or lying down? Are your shoulders relaxed, or is your breathing more steady? Just observe whatever is present, without judgment.

As we come to the end of this meditation, gently bring your awareness back to the room around you. Wiggle your fingers and toes, and when you're ready, open your eyes if they were closed. As we begin, find a comfortable position that supports your body, whether you're seated or lying down, and allow your eyes to close softly if that feels right, or simply lower your gaze.

Take a deep breath in... feeling the air fill your lungs... and then exhale slowly, releasing any tension you might be holding... Let's take another breath together, inhaling deeply... and exhaling fully... With each breath, allow yourself to settle more comfortably into the present moment... letting go of any distractions or worries...

As you continue to breathe naturally, bring your attention to the gentle rise and fall of your chest... noticing the rhythm of your breath... and how it connects you to the here and now... In this space, know that you are an important part of the world... Your presence has a ripple effect, touching lives in ways you may not even realize...

Imagine a warm, glowing light surrounding you... It represents all the small, meaningful connections you've made throughout your life... Feel its gentle warmth enveloping you, reminding you of kindnesses shared, smiles exchanged, and moments of understanding... 

With each breath, invite the light to grow brighter... Let it illuminate memories of times when you've felt supported or appreciated, no matter how small they might seem... These moments are threads in the tapestry of your life, each one adding to the richness of who you are... 

As you rest here, consider that the impact you have is not always seen or celebrated, but it is felt... Your kindness, your laughter, your presence—all these contribute to the lives of those around you... Picture the faces of people who care about you, whether they're near or far... Feel their silent support and appreciation surrounding you...

Take a moment to acknowledge that even when it feels like nobody would miss you, your existence matters... You are valued, and your presence is a gift to the world... Allow this understanding to settle into your heart, like a gentle reminder of your worth...

As we prepare to conclude this meditation, take a deep breath in, feeling the grounding presence of the earth beneath you... and exhale slowly, letting a sense of peace and belonging fill your being... 

When you're ready, gently bring your awareness back to the room... noticing the sensations in your body and the sounds around you... Wiggle your fingers and toes, and when it feels right, open your eyes or lift your gaze...

Take a deep breath in... and a slow, calming breath out... Feel the rise and fall of your breath, anchoring you to this moment. As you continue to breathe naturally, let each exhale release a bit of tension from your body... inviting relaxation into your shoulders, your jaw, your hands...

Notice the surface beneath you, supporting you... Allow its presence to remind you that you're held, you're supported... With each breath, feel a little more grounded in this space, in this time...

This light represents your inner strength and resilience, qualities that are always present, even in challenging times... With each breath, see if you can let this light grow a little brighter, a little warmer...

As you focus on this light, invite a sense of compassion for yourself... Acknowledge that it's okay to feel what you're feeling... Allow yourself to be just as you are, without judgment or expectation...

Take a moment to notice any sensations or emotions that arise, observing them with kindness and without the need to change anything... Simply being present with what is...

With each breath, feel a sense of connection to the ground beneath you, to the air around you, and to the light within you... Knowing that you are a part of a larger whole, and that your presence here matters...

Welcome to this 5-minute meditation. This practice is designed to support you in connecting with your breath and the present moment, using all the senses available to you. Find a comfortable position that works best for your body, whether seated or lying down, and allow yourself to settle in...

Let’s begin by taking a deep breath in through your nose, if you're able... and gently exhale through your mouth. Feel the air move in and out, noticing the sensation it creates within you. Continue to breathe naturally, allowing your breath to find its own rhythm...

As you breathe, bring your awareness to the sounds around you. Notice the subtle symphony that surrounds you, whether it’s the gentle hum of a distant appliance, the rustle of leaves, or the gentle rhythm of your own breathing. Allow these sounds to wash over you, anchoring you in the present moment...

Now, shift your focus to the sensations in your body. Feel the surface beneath you, supporting your weight. Notice where your body makes contact with the chair or floor, and the subtle pressure it creates. Take a moment to appreciate the support of the ground beneath you, providing a stable foundation...

With each breath, allow your body to relax further. You might notice a softening in your muscles, a gentle release of tension... Let this relaxation spread from the top of your head down to your toes, inviting a sense of calm and ease...

If thoughts arise, acknowledge them kindly and let them drift away like leaves on a stream. Gently guide your attention back to the sensations and sounds, using them as an anchor to bring you back to this moment...

As we near the end of this meditation, take a few more deep breaths... Inhale deeply, feeling the air fill your lungs... and exhale slowly, releasing any remaining tension. Allow a sense of gratitude to fill your heart – gratitude for this moment, for your breath, and for the time you've taken for yourself...

When you're ready, slowly bring your awareness back to the space around you. Wiggle your fingers and toes, perhaps stretch your arms gently. As you open your eyes, or simply lift your gaze within, carry this sense of presence and calm with you into the rest of your day...

Thank you for joining this meditation. May you continue to find peace and presence in each moment.

Allow your body to settle, and take a deep breath in... and release it slowly. Let's do this a few more times, breathing in deeply... and letting go with each exhale...

Now, notice any areas of tension in your body. There's no need to change anything—simply observe how your body feels in this moment. As you continue to breathe, imagine sending your breath to those areas... softening and easing them with each gentle inhale and exhale...

Acknowledge these sensations without judgment, just noticing what is present. As you breathe, imagine a soothing wave of relaxation washing over your hands... calming and comforting them...

Now, shift your attention to your shoulders. If it's comfortable, allow them to relax, releasing any tightness with each slow breath out... Imagine your shoulders becoming lighter, as if a gentle breeze is helping them to release any burdens they might be holding...

Let this sense of ease travel down to your legs, in whatever way feels right for you... You might notice sensations in your thighs, knees, or feet. Whatever you're experiencing, accept it with kindness and compassion. Visualize a warm, soothing light surrounding your legs, bringing comfort and relief...

Continue to breathe naturally, feeling the rhythm of your breath... Let it guide you to a place of calm and presence. Remember, this practice is here to support you, allowing you to embrace each moment with gentleness and care...

As we come to the close of this meditation, take a few more deep breaths... Slowly bring your awareness back to the room, noticing the sounds around you, the sensation of where your body touches the surface beneath you... When you're ready, gently open your eyes or lift your gaze...

Thank you for sharing this time with me. May you carry this sense of ease and presence with you throughout your day.

With each breath, imagine a gentle wave of relaxation washing over you, soothing and calming every part of your body.

If you notice any areas of tension or discomfort, send a breath there, inviting softness and ease. Remember, each breath is an opportunity to let go of what no longer serves you. Inhale deeply, feeling your body expand... and exhale, releasing any tightness or stress.

Thank you for joining this meditation. May you find peace and ease wherever you are.

This light represents the presence of the divine, a comforting and loving energy that envelopes you in safety and warmth. Feel its gentle embrace as it surrounds you, offering a sense of peace and connection...

Allow yourself to be present with this feeling, knowing that you are supported and held by something greater than yourself. As you breathe in, imagine this divine light filling you with love and compassion... and as you breathe out, let any worries or concerns drift away, carried off by the soft glow...

You might notice sensations of warmth or tingling, or perhaps a deep sense of stillness within. Whatever you feel is perfectly okay... Simply be with these sensations, letting them unfold naturally, without judgment...

If your mind begins to wander, gently guide your attention back to the sensation of the breath and the presence of the light surrounding you. Each breath is an opportunity to reconnect with this divine presence, to feel the love and peace that it offers...

Take a moment to rest in this connection, allowing it to nourish and sustain you... Feel the gentle support of the divine presence within and around you, as if you are held in a space of unconditional love...

As we begin to conclude this meditation, take a few deeper breaths, feeling gratitude for this moment of connection and peace. Know that this sense of divine presence is always within reach, accessible whenever you choose to return to it...

When you're ready, gently bring your awareness back to the room... Wiggle your fingers and toes, feeling the surface beneath you... And when it feels right, open your eyes, carrying this sense of divine presence with you into the rest of your day...

Thank you for joining this meditation.

all_results.response_preview: Welcome to this 5-minute meditation. Today, we will gently explore the unfolding path of finding your life's purpose, inviting clarity and understanding into your journey. Allow yourself to settle int...
all_results.full_response:
Welcome to this 5-minute meditation. Today, we will gently explore the unfolding path of finding your life's purpose, inviting clarity and understanding into your journey. Allow yourself to settle into a comfortable position that supports your body, whether sitting, lying down, or resting in whatever way feels right for you. 

Begin by bringing your awareness to your breath... noticing the natural rhythm as you inhale... and exhale... Feel the air entering your body, filling your lungs with life, and leaving effortlessly, carrying away any tension or worry... With each breath, allow yourself to become more present, more open to the possibilities that await you...

Now, softly close your eyes or lower your gaze, if that feels comfortable... Gently shift your focus inward, to the space within you where thoughts and dreams reside... Imagine that you are in a peaceful, safe place—this could be a garden, a beach, a forest, or any place that brings you peace... 

In this serene setting, envision a path before you... This path represents your journey, your unique life experience... As you stand at the beginning of this path, take a moment to acknowledge all that you have accomplished so far... the lessons learned, the growth achieved... 

Now, as you begin to walk along this path, notice what arises within you... What brings you joy? What activities make time feel as though it flies by?... These are clues, hints left by your soul, pointing toward your life purpose...

With each step, allow these feelings of joy and passion to become clearer... Breathing in, welcome these insights... Breathing out, release any doubt or hesitation... Trust in the wisdom that emerges from within...

As you continue walking, imagine encountering a gentle guide—this could be an aspect of yourself, a wise figure, or even the spirit of nature... This guide is here to support you, to help illuminate the path ahead... Ask this guide: "What is my purpose?" Listen with an open heart to whatever message comes, knowing that it may not be words, but rather feelings or images...

Pause for a moment here... Allow the message to settle within you... Trust that clarity will continue to unfold in its own time, as you remain open and receptive...

As this meditation draws to a close, thank your guide for their presence and wisdom... Slowly bring your awareness back to your breath... Feel the ground beneath you, the air around you... 

When you are ready, gently open your eyes or lift your gaze, bringing with you any insights or feelings of purpose that have emerged... Carry this sense of possibility into your day, knowing that each step you take is part of your unique journey... 

Thank you for joining this meditation. May you continue to discover and embrace your life's purpose with openness and curiosity.

all_results.full_response:
Welcome to this 5-minute meditation. Today, we will create a space of peace and reflection to honor and feel a sense of connection with loved ones who have passed. This practice is about cultivating a gentle awareness and opening our hearts to the memories and the love that transcends time.

Begin by finding a comfortable position that feels right for you... whether you're sitting or lying down, allow your body to relax into the support beneath you. Let your eyes softly close, or lower your gaze if that feels more comfortable. 

Take a deep breath in... and slowly release it out... Feel the air moving in through your nose, filling your lungs, and gently flowing out... Continue to breathe naturally, allowing each breath to bring a sense of calm and ease...

Now, as you continue to breathe, imagine a warm, gentle light surrounding you... This light is filled with love and comfort, a reminder of the connection that remains with your loved ones... Allow this light to envelop you, holding you in a gentle embrace...

With each breath, invite a sense of openness into your heart... As you breathe in, feel your heart space expand, creating room for the love and memories you hold dear... As you breathe out, release any tension or heaviness, making space for peace and remembrance...

Take a moment now to bring to mind a cherished memory of your loved one... It could be a moment of joy, a shared laugh, or a simple time spent together... Allow this memory to arise naturally, without forcing it... 

As this memory comes to the forefront of your mind, notice any feelings or sensations within your body... Allow yourself to fully experience this moment, embracing the warmth and love it brings... 

If you wish, silently offer a message from your heart to your loved one... It could be words of love, gratitude, or simply a greeting... Trust that these words, carried on the breath, reach them in the way that is right for you...

Take a few more breaths here, resting in the comfort of this connection... Know that the love shared continues to be a part of you, woven into the fabric of your being...

When you feel ready, gently bring your awareness back to the present moment... Feel the surface beneath you, the air around you... Wiggle your fingers and toes, reawakening your body to the space you're in...

And when you're ready, slowly open your eyes, carrying with you the warmth and peace of this experience. Remember, the love you share is always with you, a guiding light in your heart.
